intro: Solanum dryanderense, commonly known as the Dryander's nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, white or pale blue flowers are followed by bright red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Solanum dryanderense is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for certain wildlife.
